Package ohos.sensor.data

Class CategoryOrientationData

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.sensor.data.SensorData<CategoryOrientation>
      • ohos.sensor.data.CategoryOrientationData

  • public class CategoryOrientationData
extends SensorData<CategoryOrientation>
    Inherits from SensorData and describes data information of orientation sensors.

    The data information includes the timestamps, accuracy, data values, and data dimensions of sensors. This class also provides the method for constructing a CategoryOrientationData instance.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    SensorData, CategoryOrientation
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Sensors#SENSOR

    • Method Detail

      • getQuaternionValues

        public static float[] getQuaternionValues​(float[] rotationVector)
        Obtains a quaternion from data of a rotation vector sensor.
        Parameters:
        rotationVector - Indicates the rotation vector sensor data, in which the first four elements represent the x, y, z, and w components respectively.
        Returns:
        Returns the quaternion, in which each element represents the w, x, y, and z components of the rotation vector sensor respectively.
        Since:
        4

      • getDeviceRotationMatrix

        public static void getDeviceRotationMatrix​(float[] rotationMatrix,
                                           float[] rotationVector)
        Obtains the rotation matrix of the current device position based on the rotation vector.
        Parameters:
        rotationMatrix - Indicates a floating-point array to store the rotation matrix. The array length can be 9 (to store a three-dimensional rotation matrix) or 16 (to store a four-dimensional rotation matrix).
        rotationVector - Indicates the rotation vector.
        Since:
        5

      • getDeviceOrientation

        public static float[] getDeviceOrientation​(float[] rotationMatrix,
                                           float[] rotationAngle)
        Obtains the device orientation based on the rotation matrix.
        Parameters:
        rotationMatrix - Indicates the rotation matrix, which can be obtained via getDeviceRotationMatrix(float[], float[]).
        rotationAngle - Indicates a floating-point array to store the three device orientation values. The value rotationAngle[0] indicates rotation around the Z axis. It represents the azimuth, that is, the angle between the Y axis of the device and the magnetic north pole. rotationAngle[1] indicates rotation around the X axis. It represents the pitch, that is, the angle between the plane parallel to the device screen and the plane parallel to the ground. rotationAngle[2] indicates rotation around the Y axis. It represents the roll, that is, the angle between the plane perpendicular to the device screen and the plane perpendicular to the ground.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of rotationAngle values.
        Since:
        5
